conclusion: To determine how the objects A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves forward above the objects.
Object A is a group of mushrooms located on the ground.
Object B is a rock-like object located on the ground.
Object C is a white dress-like object located on the ground.
Object D is a book located on the ground.
The light source is moving forward above the objects.
The light source moving forward will cause the objects to move downward and forward relative to the light source.
The size of the objects will not change because they are on the ground and not illuminated by the light source.
The size of the light source will not change because it is a fixed object.
Object A will move downward and forward relative to the light source.
Object B will move downward and forward relative to the light source.
Object C will move downward and forward relative to the light source.
Object D will move downward and forward relative to the light source.
In summary, all four objects will move downward and forward relative to the light source.
